skill.name: test-driven-development
skill.description: Use when implementing any feature or bugfix, before writing implementation code
skill.summary: Use when implementing any feature or bugfix, before writing implementation code
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown files. No executable code, network requests, or file system operations. All static findings are false positives: backticks are markdown code fences (not shell execution), SHA mentions are in documentation (not crypto code), and file references are local documentation links. The skill provides TDD methodology guidance only.

content.value_statement: Writing tests after code passes immediately and proves nothing. Test-first forces you to see the test fail, proving it actually tests the right behavior. TDD catches bugs before they reach production and enables confident refactoring.
actual_capabilities: Provides test verification commands and checklists
Identifies common TDD rationalizations and red flags
limitations: Does not generate specific test code - user provides test content
Does not execute or run tests automatically
Does not integrate with specific testing frameworks
Does not provide test coverage analysis

use_cases.title: New Feature Implementation
use_cases.description: Write failing test first for new feature, implement minimal code to pass, then refactor while keeping tests green

use_cases.title: Bug Reproduction Tests
use_cases.description: Create failing test that reproduces the bug, fix the code to make test pass, ensuring regression prevention

use_cases.title: TDD Process Validation
use_cases.description: Verify code was written using TDD by checking that tests existed before implementation and failed first

prompt_templates.title: Start TDD Cycle
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply TDD methodology. First, help me write a failing test for [describe feature/bug]. I want to see it fail before implementing any solution.

prompt_templates.title: Refactor Safely
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me refactor [code section] while keeping all tests passing. Show me how TDD enables safe refactoring.

prompt_templates.title: Write Better Tests
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my test for [functionality] and suggest improvements. Is this testing real behavior or just mock existence?

prompt_templates.title: Debug with Tests
prompt_templates.prompt: I found a bug in [component]. Help me write a failing test that reproduces it, then use TDD to fix it properly.

output_examples.input: Help me implement a retry function using TDD
output: Step 1 - Write failing test: Define expected retry behavior with test that fails
Step 2 - Verify RED: Run test to confirm it fails for expected reason
Step 3 - Write minimal code: Implement just enough to pass the test
Step 4 - Verify GREEN: Confirm test passes and all tests still pass
Step 5 - Refactor: Clean up code while keeping tests green
Step 6 - Repeat: Next failing test for next feature

output_examples.input: I need to fix a bug where empty emails are accepted
output: First, write a failing test that proves empty email should be rejected
Run the test and confirm it fails with 'Email required' error
Implement minimal fix: add validation to check email.trim()
Run tests again to confirm fix works and all tests pass
Refactor extraction of validation logic if needed for multiple fields

best_practices: Always watch each test fail before implementing - proves test actually tests what you need
Write minimal code to pass tests - resist adding features not required by tests
Use real code in tests - mocks should isolate dependencies, not be the thing being tested
anti_patterns: Writing implementation code before the test - delete and start over with TDD
Testing mock behavior instead of real component behavior
Keeping implementation code as reference while writing tests - you will adapt it

faq.question: What testing frameworks work with this skill?
faq.answer: This skill provides TDD methodology. Works with any framework like Jest, Vitest, pytest, JUnit, or Mocha.

faq.question: What are the limits of TDD?
faq.answer: TDD is unsuitable for throwaway prototypes, generated code, and configuration files. Ask your human partner for exceptions.

faq.question: How does TDD integrate with existing code?
faq.answer: Add tests for existing code before modifying it. TDD prevents regressions when changing legacy systems.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using TDD?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill provides guidance only. No code execution, no file access, no data collection.

faq.question: What if my test passes immediately?
faq.answer: You are testing existing behavior, not required behavior. Fix the test to describe what SHOULD happen, not what currently happens.

faq.question: How is this different from test-after development?
faq.answer: Test-after answers what does this code do. TDD answers what should this code do. Test-first forces edge case discovery before implementing.
